moves.4. e3 a6: Black looks for attack right away on the queenside, and it is not a bad strategy.
moves.5. Nbd2 Nc6 6. c3: I cannot allow black to penetrate too easily.
moves.6... b6: Better was B5, for that matter. But now I have a breath I don't fail to take.
moves.7. Ne5: The exchange leaves black completely undeveloped, and he must defend the knight.
moves.7... Bb7: This slowens a lot black's attack on this side. But black's position is not all that weak, and if allowed to develop, will be as strong as mine.
moves.8. Qg4: So I decided to go to attack before the game switches again on the queenside. It was not a good idea Qh5 (threatening f7), black has many good ways to defend. But this move tempted him to...
moves.8... Nf6: , of course, that is very good. Now let's prove that my queen out there is a threat or a loser.
moves.10. Qg3: Now I expected Nh5, and my plan gets a question mark.
moves.10... O-O: If Bh6, Nh5. But fortunately for me, my opponent overlooked Nh5 right now, so I can complete my scheme.
moves.11... g6: Good. It weakens his pawns. But this means that g6 is very near to...
moves.12. h4: h5 would be nasty, but black should have preferred it to...
moves.12... h5: ...because it gives me a ready-made position for a sac. Any other move and black goes NxN and I have to sac the lsb. Now, Bh6 could have been good. Re8, and I would have given a look at Nxf7.
moves.13. Nxg6 fxg6 14. Qxg6+ Kh8: NOw... what? This should be a winning position for white. I just have to find the right way. And I need more pieces into the attack.
moves.15... Qe8: I expected Rg8. It is interesting to see if black can defend in that line.
moves.16... Nh7 17. Bd3: Bxh5 was enough to win, I think.
moves.17... Qf7: Sensible move by black. Bxh5 was better.
moves.18. Rf3: If Bg6, Qg7. But now I use the rook.
moves.18... Qg7: Another good try, but I don't go for e6.
moves.19. Qxh5: This is much better, since the queen can't move (but to f7).
moves.19... Qxg2: It would have been nice to see if black could have resisted, but this is a sad blunder.
